question.title: My Android App is not showing Ads (Banner & Interstitial)

  @Override

      mediaPlayer = null;

  @Override

    if (mediaPlayer != null && mediaPlayer.isPlaying()) {

              .setNegativeButton("Non", null)
              .show();
    } else {
      super.onBackPressed();
    }

  private String formatTime(int millis) {
    int minutes = (millis / 1000) / 60;
    int seconds = (millis / 1000) % 60;
    return String.format("%02d:%02d", minutes, seconds);
  }

answers.body:
Please make sure that your Ad Unit ID has the appropriate type set in the Admob Console:

If your Ad format type does not match the one actually used in your XML, you might get this 403 error.

If that does not resolve it, try to use the Troubleshooter.

Finally, there is this post on the Help Center:

  1. Each AdMob account must be associated with both an AdSense account and a Google Ads account. AdMob uses each of these accounts to manage certain parts of your AdMob account:

How does AdMob use AdSense & Google Ads? (AdSense > to be sure tax/address/name and more verify, and Google Ads need to be verify)

  1. Make sure that the account setup is fully completed. Name, address, phone number and tax info in your AdMob account with verification if applicable.

Select payment option
Provide your tax information
Verify your identity (not required in all locations)
Verify your address and payee name
Earn enough to meet the payment threshold

Steps to getting paid

  1. Have you followed all the instructions in the Google Developers Get Started guide?
    (Android, iOS, Unity)

  2. Have you integrated the Google Mobile Ads SDK correctly?
    Take a look at the sample apps available for Android and iOS.

Sample apps show how to use the Google Mobile Ads SDK to place ads into apps.
Test your implementation code to check that ads can show.

  1. Enable SKAdNetwork to track conversions (for iOS)
    https://developers.google.com/admob/ios/ios14

  2. Your categories ads block? Block ads by general category
    (more information about: Guide to allowing & blocking ads in your apps)

  3. Work good? Set up an app-ads.txt file for your app

  4. Have error? Policy center

  5. Check the eCPM floor settings not on high (recommend all prices)

  6. Is your app crashing? Check for crashes and application not responding (ANR) errors for your apps (Android, iOS).

  7. AdMob > Setting > Account Information > Seller Information > Change to > Transparent
    AdSense > Setting > Account Information > Seller Information > Change to > Transparent
    (Need change in both AdSense + AdMob)

  8. Enable user metrics for your apps (is it active?)

  9. Your app live on the Play Store / App Store and linked?
    Link your app to an app store

  10. AdMob > Apps > Your App > Approval status > It’s on "Ready"?

  11. In the Play Console, is the status on "Yes, my app contains ads"?
